markdown:
<title
    level="1"
    right="Item 6"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Peachwood Talisman](/Equipment.aspx?ID=3471)
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Uncommon" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=721" />
<trait label="Consumable" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=564" />
<trait label="Magical" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=644" />
<trait label="Talisman" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=709" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [Tian Xia Character Guide](/Sources.aspx?ID=230) pg. 130, [Book of the Dead](/Sources.aspx?ID=118) pg. 20

**Price** 40 gp

<row gap="medium">

**Usage** affixed to armor

</row>

<row gap="medium">

 

 

 
</row>

</column>

---

Symbols of good fortune and luck are carved on this thin, square wooden plaque. It smells of sandalwood from the blessings placed upon it. After activation, for the next minute , you can sense attacks from [undead](/Traits.aspx?ID=722). You aren't [off-guard](/Conditions.aspx?ID=58) to [hidden](/Conditions.aspx?ID=79), [undetected](/Conditions.aspx?ID=96), or [flanking](/Rules.aspx?ID=2375), undead of your level or lower, or undead of your level or lower using [surprise attack](/Classes.aspx?ID=37). However, they can still help their allies flank.

<column gap="tiny">

</column>
name: Peachwood Talisman
